item.title: Diamonds looking to change things up in second netball Test against South Africa
item.description: Australian coach Stacey Marinkovich says she needs to try different combinations ahead of the Test series against New Zealand.

item.title: NSW Police intercept alleged 'kill team' near daycare centre in Revesby
item.description: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a daycare centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Players concerned over Shanghai heat as Novak Djokovic collapses on court
item.description: Holger Rune says "there is always a limit" as soaring temperatures and humidity in Shanghai and Wuhan tennis events cause player distress.

item.title: WA iron ore mining shows no signs of slowing despite price drop concerns
item.description: Australia's two biggest iron ore miners continue to expand their operations in WA's Pilbara, despite warnings of waning demand.

item.title: More families raising children with cystic fibrosis staying in the bush
item.description: Two mums in rural Queensland have spoken about why they choose to live more than 1,000 kilometres from the Queensland Children's Hospital.

item.title: Single farmers in Western Australia ditch dating apps for something face to face
item.description: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

item.title: WA's Bibbulmun Track running record broken twice in one week
item.description: Two men have smashed the record for completing one of the world's longest walking tracks in the fastest time, within days of each other.

item.title: Qantas says 'legal protections in place' as cyber hacking group threatens to release personal data
item.description: Qantas says it is continuing to support customers as a hacking group threatens to release personal data from around 40 companies to the dark web.

item.title: Strava is suing Garmin for patent infringement. Here's what we know
item.description: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

item.title: Do dishwashers release microplastics when you wash plastic containers and kitchenware?
item.description: If you're worried about microplastics, is it safe to wash plastic containers and other utensils in the dishwasher, given the use of heat and detergents? We asked two experts.

item.title: Diamonds put foot down to beat South Africa in 67-40 victory
item.description: Australia flew out of the blocks to take a 2-0 lead in the series and extend their unbeaten record against South Africa to an extraordinary 48 wins.

item.title: Can we still trust Australia's sunscreens?
item.description: Summer is just around the corner, and many Australians are confused right now about which sunscreens they can trust.

item.title: Renewed focus on 'kill cars' as police swarm on hit crew in Sydney's south-west
item.description: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

item.title: Third narco sub found in Solomon Islands, as cocaine and meth trafficking comes to the Pacific
item.description: Cousins Reubenson and Martin Fugui found a 'Made in Colombia' narco sub in Solomon Islands over the weekend — the third such vessel found in the country's waters over the past year.

item.title: Domain rental report for September quarter shows rent for houses stable across combined capital cities
item.description: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

item.title: Man who turned to weightlifting for health now headed to powerlifting world championships at 82
item.description: Ravi Sood turned to the gym to help build muscle before a knee replacement. It has changed his life and led him to the World Masters Powerlifting Championships.

item.title: Endometriosis sufferers battling to manage pain as system struggles to cope
item.description: Women suffering from the chronic pain associated with endometriosis have called for more government investment into understanding the condition, with an expert warning the mental effects can be just as debilitating as the physical symptoms.

item.title: Alex de Minaur wins 50th tennis match for 2025, reaching Shanghai Masters clash with Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Alex de Minaur wins 50 matches in a season for the first time in his career as he reaches the quarterfinals at the Shanghai Masters.

item.title: Measles warning issued in WA's Pilbara as confirmed cases rise
item.description: Health authorities say they are not able to trace WA's latest measles cases to a source, meaning they cannot tell how far the virus has spread.

item.title: Mount Gambier's Urgent Care Clinic to reopen but GP shortage continues
item.description: While a government-funded medical clinic is set to reopen, residents in SA's second biggest city are still struggling to access local care.

item.title: How reading romance has helped keep the spark alive for this couple
item.description: After 10 years of marriage and two kids, Joseph Heath and wife Laura are still in the "honeymoon phase". He says romance novels are a large part of why.

item.title: Jane Fonda joins other stars to revive a group that emerged during Hollywood's anti-communist panic
item.description: The original group was formed in October 1947 at a time when the US government worried that there were communists in Hollywood who were putting left-wing propaganda into the movies.

item.title: Netball fights for recognition amid influx of women's sports
item.description: Netball Australia is taking elite-level netball to regional communities, hoping to showcase the sport's global impact and inspire the next generation of athletes.

item.title: László Krasznahorkai awarded Nobel Prize in Literature for 'visionary' work that 'reaffirms the power of art'
item.description: László Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, one of the world's most prestigious writing awards.

item.title: Sick sea turtle rescued from algal bloom recovering at Adelaide Zoo
item.description: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A viral gaffe, supermoon shots and vintage cars
item.description: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

item.title: Beyond Blue survey finds loneliness has deeper impact on some Australians' mental health than financial hardship
item.description: A new national report by Beyond Blue has revealed loneliness and social isolation has reached new heights, with 46 per cent of respondents listing it as a bigger mental health stressor than financial hardship.

item.title: Why Alliyah is identifying themselves as a victim-survivor — and the power this act holds
item.description: Alliyah's decision to talk about their abuse was a brave act that exposed the red flags that weren't caught along the way — and they hope it helps others.

item.title: Global pilot shortage could mean more delays after push to raise retirement age
item.description: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

item.title: Man returns to boxing after sepsis forces partial amputations of his arms and legs
item.description: Adam Smith became "fixated" on returning to the gym after sepsis forced the partial amputation of his arms and legs. Now he can press 365 kilograms and get back into boxing.

item.title: Boy, 16, among three alleged 'contract criminals' charged in Sydney 'kill car' blitz
item.description: Strike Force Flodine is investigating a network of alleged "contract criminals" hired by organised crime groups, and their use of staged vehicles or "kill cars" in Sydney.

item.title: Novak Djokovic advances to Shanghai Masters semifinals, qualifier Valentin Vacherot continues fairytale run
item.description: Fourth seed Novak Djokovic battled past a spirited Zizou Bergs 6-3 7-5 on Thursday to reach the Shanghai Masters semifinals for a 10th time, setting up a clash with surprise package and world number 204 Valentin Vacherot.

item.title: Principals' power to ban aggressive parents from school grounds to extend to social media behaviour
item.description: Principals in Victoria already have the power to ban aggressive or violent parents from school grounds, but the state government is looking to apply the power to parents' behaviour on social media.

item.title: Federal government investigates PFAS spread in Rockhampton amid concern for property prices
item.description: Christine Stasch was planning to sell her family farm and retire further north. Now, she is fighting for compensation after discovering PFAS contamination on her property.

item.title: PM says there's 'nothing unusual' in Treasury meeting on contentious superannuation tax proposal
item.description: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

item.title: Patients may not see benefits of $8.5 billlion bulk-billing boost for four years
item.description: Patients may not see the benefits of higher bulk-billing for years, and average-out-of-pocket costs are expected to rise, the health department has conceded — despite $8.5 billion being tipped into the GP subsidy scheme from November.

item.title: Can you ever throw out a previous home owner or renter's mail?
item.description: Even years after moving in, you might still be receiving someone else’s bills and letters. Here’s what can you do about it.

item.title: FBI 'seizes and destroys' website linked to hackers threatening to release Qantas customers' data
item.description: The seizure comes less than 24 hours before a deadline set by the hackers for around 40 global firms to pay a ransom to prevent the release of sensitive information is due to end.

item.title: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado awarded Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The Venezuelan opposition leader is awarded the prize for "her tireless work promoting democratic rights" in the country.

item.title: Japan's decorated trucks face 'extinction' but fans and truckies are trying to bring them back
item.description: The dekotora, large decorated trucks covered in colour and bright lights, were once a common sight across Japan. Now they are fighting for survival.

item.title: Alex de Minaur loses 6-4, 6-4 to Daniil Medvedev in Shanghai quarterfinals to miss out on career milestone
item.description: Alex de Minaur is eliminated from the Shanghai Masters, going down 6-4, 6-4 to former world number one Danil Medvedev in the quarterfinals, denying the 26-year-old Australian a chance of his 300th tour win.

item.title: Lung cancer researchers identify 'breakthrough' patterns predictive of treatment success
item.description: University of Queensland researcher Arutha Kulasinghe studied lung biopsies from the tumours of almost 250 patients with non-small cell lung cancer across Australia, the United States and Europe.

item.title: Crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and garlic yoghurt is an easy dinner - ABC News
item.description: This popular vegetarian Lebanese dish with crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and a garlicky tahini yoghurt sauce is ready in 30 minutes.

item.title: National Rugby League award for Karratha Kangaroos named best community club
item.description: WA may traditionally be an AFL state but a club in the Pilbara has been named among the nation's best in another footy code.

item.title: Genomic medicine researchers work to fix 'European bias' in DNA databases
item.description: Researchers are trying to fix the "Western bias" contained in many DNA databases with a new national project targeting multicultural communities.

item.title: Hackers release Qantas customers' data on dark web
item.description: Hackers have released personal data from Qantas customers onto the dark web, following a cyber attack in July.

item.title: How did a mother and daughter at the centre of a suspected murder-suicide 'slip through the cracks'
item.description: The suspected murder-suicide of a mother and her daughter has raised serious questions about whether there were missed opportunities to intervene.

item.title: A new supermarket has been invited to Australia. Here's what that might mean
item.description: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple.

item.title: Cost blowout fears cloud $3.2b Women's and Children's Hospital
item.description: The Malinauskas government has become well-versed in the language of cost blowouts, and the $3.2 billion Women's and Children's Hospital is another chance for it to flex its vocabulary.

item.title: Diane Keaton, star of Annie Hall, The Godfather films dies at 79
item.description: The unexpected news of Keaton's passing has been met with shock around the world, with stars remembering their time with the actor.

item.title: How these volunteers are transforming hospital stays one 'goodie' at a time
item.description: More than 6,000 gifts are made each year by the charity Good Omen Goodeze. For patients like Zyan, these knitted toys are more than fun — they’re therapeutic.

item.title: Indigenous community Bidyadanga hosts From the Desert to the Seaside music festival
item.description: From the Desert to the Seaside arts and music festival brings Western Australia's largest remote community of Bidyadanga together.

item.title: From The Godfather to The First Wives Club — here are Diane Keaton's best films
item.description: With a career beginning in the late 1970s, Diane Keaton would star in more than 100 films and earn several Oscar nods.

item.title: How long can you safely store and reheat leftovers?
item.description: Experts share their tips on how to best store cooked food to save money and avoid food waste.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds defeat South Africa's Proteas 65-42 in third netball Test
item.description: Australia warms up for the eagerly anticipated Constellation Cup with a convincing 65-42 victory over South Africa in the third and final Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Ethan Strange stars as PM's XIII defeat Papua New Guinea 28-10
item.description: Ethan Strange underlines his case for Kangaroos selection and Trai Fuller scores four tries in the Prime Minister's XIII 28-10 defeat of Papua New Guinea.

item.title: Vacherot becomes lowest-ranked ATP Masters winner after defeating his cousin Rinderknech in Shanghai
item.description: He beat his cousin Arthur Rinderknech 4-6, 6-3, 6-3 on Sunday local time to claim the first title of his career after a stunning run from the qualifying rounds.

item.title: Damir left 17-year-old Jelena to face unhappy Australian fans at Rod Laver Arena.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Social media ban will further isolate regional and rural youth, LGBTIQA+ advocates say
item.description: LGBTIQA+ advocates are concerned the social media ban will have a significant impact on queer youth in regional and remote areas of Australia. They say there are not enough offline, physical supports for these teens to access when the ban comes into effect.

item.title: Committee formally recommends NT government adopt voluntary assisted dying
item.description: On the verandah of their Darwin home, Judy Dent held her husband's hand as he became the first person in the world to die through legally accessible voluntary assisted dying. That world-first would not be possible in the Northern Territory today.

item.title: Treasurer announces rework of stalled superannuation tax increase plan
item.description: The government has bowed to pressure on its superannuation tax policy, one of the few revenue-raising measures it had promised, two years on from when it was first announced.

item.title: How to tell if your Qantas personal data has hit the dark web and what you can do if it has
item.description: Hackers have released Qantas customer data onto the dark web. Here's what experts say to look out for if you think your personal data may be caught up in the leak and what actions you can take.

item.title: Pink Elephants report highlights care gaps for rural women experiencing miscarriages
item.description: Pregnancy loss is a lottery determined by location, according to a report that has sparked calls for the federal government to improve care for women who experience miscarriage in regional and rural communities.

item.title: Patients of a Mortdale dentist practice urged to get tested for blood-borne viruses including HIV
item.description: Safuan Hasic, also known as Steven Hasic, has been barred from practising after breaching infection control standards at his Mortdale dentistry practice.

item.title: What to do if your mortgage payments haven't gone down despite an RBA rate cut
item.description: You might assume home loan repayments will automatically reduce when an interest rate cut is passed on, but this isn’t always the case. Here's how to check.

item.title: Here's how Labor's revised super proposal would work
item.description: Every prominent criticism of the tax has been addressed, with the result that it will apply to fewer people and raise less money.

item.title: Major review of medical scans at Caboolture Hospital to include 3,500 more patients
item.description: Thousands more patients have been caught up in a bungle involving medical scans not being reviewed by doctors at a major south-east Queensland hospital.

item.title: Jesse Southwell signs with Broncos amid fears of lopsided NRLW competition
item.description: NSW State of Origin halfback Jesse Southwell's two-year deal with the Brisbane Broncos may add to the debate about the NRLW's competitiveness since it expanded to 12 teams.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds mindful they need to lift against New Zealand's Silver Ferns in Constellation Cup
item.description: Despite the comfortable series win over South Africa, Australia is mindful it will need to step up a gear in the Constellation Cup against New Zealand.

item.description: The airline's customers voice their concerns and disappointment after cybercriminals release their personal data on the dark web.

item.title: Corporate watchdog slams superannuation funds on 'customer service', communications with retirees
item.description: ASIC's review of 12 super funds collectively responsible for more $1.2 trillion in member assets finds they are failing in customer service and communications, and may not be giving members information to make informed retirement decisions.

item.title: Outback golf tournament brings together 150 players to support Royal Flying Doctor Service
item.description: There are no manicured greens in sight, but this golf tournament brings more than 150 players to an outback sheep station to raise funds for the Royal Flying Doctor Service.

item.title: NT government accused of 'turning a blind eye' to gas company's alleged environmental breach
item.description: A gas company operating in the Northern Territory has been accused of breaching environmental laws by an NT government department, which decided against prosecution in favour of a formal letter encouraging "behaviour change".

item.title: How to help kids prepare for music exams and competitions and manage performance anxiety
item.description: Music exams and competitions aren't easy, but our experts have some tips to make the process as stress-free as possible, including managing performance anxiety.

item.title: Six NRL players named in England rugby league Ashes sqaud, Man of Steel winner not selected
item.description: Six NRL players are in the England rugby league squad for the upcoming Ashes series against Australia, but there's no room for the most consistent player of the Super League season.

item.description: Alexei Popyrin's ATP Tour return has ended with defeat as Australia's second-highest-ranked men's player returns following a back injury.

item.title: Midnight Oil fans rally to keep Rob Hirst's drum kit 'in public hands' at charity auction
item.description: Midnight Oil drummer Rob Hirst auctions off the kit, which he has had since 1979, saying he can no longer play it because of his battle with pancreatic cancer.

item.description: Experts on the rules around when you need to inform your employer if you’re planning to take parental leave.

item.title: Governments announce full details of $102.5m algal bloom summer plan
item.description: Large scale reef restoration, new real-time water monitoring and a $1 million trial of "AI-powered submersible cytobots" are part of a $102.5 million government algal bloom program to ensure "South Australians can enjoy their summer".

item.description: As the 70-year-old songwriter prepares his 30th album, he talks about the music that has driven him creatively.

item.title: Noosa mayor says fraudsters used AI imitation in $2.3m council scam
item.description: The mayor of a small council that lost nearly $2 million in a "sophisticated" scam says international fraudsters were able to "imitate personalities" using AI.

item.title: As illicit tobacco sales rise into the billions, economist Arthur Laffer puts blame on high tobacco taxation rate
item.description: Internal tobacco industry data estimates the illicit tobacco market now makes up 64 per cent of all tobacco consumed in Australia and 82 per cent of the total nicotine consumed.

item.title: Police officer had 'high likelihood of PTSD' at time of death, inquest told
item.description: A coronial inquest will explore whether the 2022 death of SA Police Senior Constable Benjamin Edward Warren could have been prevented if his mental health issues had been identified.

item.title: Indie film producers tell SXSW Sydney about how to survive and thrive making horror
item.description: Horror films can be a great training ground for filmmakers, but there is also a gritty reality, a panel of indie producers tells SXSW Sydney.

item.title: WA's flu season exceeds 30,000 cases as authorities blame low vaccination rates
item.description: Western Australia records its worst flu season on record, with more than 30,000 influenza cases reported this year.

item.title: Abducted by Hamas, Noa never lost hope she would see her 'soulmate' again
item.description: Noa and Avinatan's abduction from a music festival became an enduring illustration of the horrors endured by Israelis on October 7. Now safely in each other's arms, a chapter has closed on a harrowing two years.

item.title: An embarrassing backflip by Chalmers on super or a strategic shift?
item.description: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

item.title: Why does SA have a summer plan for the algal bloom and what's in it?
item.description: The full details of South Australia's algal bloom summer plan which aims to ensure South Australians can "enjoy their summer" were released yesterday. The plan includes measures to protect the state's coast while supporting businesses and communities.

item.description: The findings are released as more Queensland councils opt out of water fluoridation and amid rising rates of misinformation.

item.description: Hidden figures and inscriptions are being discovered beneath some of Australia's most famous paintings as conservators use infrared technology to reveal details in Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly series, unseen since the artist's own time.

item.description: Reece Walsh has built a compelling case for selection in the Kangaroos' starting line-up to face England, but coach Kevin Walters says he will not show favouritism towards the Maroons contingent in his squad.

item.description: Nurses working at a medical centre in southern NSW are stepping onto the frontline of patient care to ease the burden on GPs.

item.description: The NRLW judiciary adds more pain to the Sydney Roosters' grand-final loss to the Brisbane Broncos, with forward Aliyah Nasio banned for four matches.

item.description: Under planned government cuts to vocational training in Tasmania, young aspiring creatives are worried about a loss of opportunity in their home state.

item.description: The Untitled (How Does It Feel) singer died after a long struggle with cancer, his family said.

item.description: Midnight Oil are Sydney rock royalty, but the drum kit that stuck with the band for more than 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

item.description: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

item.description: The Back to the Future star has been candid about life with the degenerative neurological condition.

item.description: Only a rain downpour against Pakistan prevents England from recording its first defeat of the World Cup, as Australia looks to book its berth in knockout stages.

item.description: Despite the offer of a $2 million lifeline to keep a private mental health clinic in Hobart open, last-minute wobbles could yet scupper the rescue bid, as the clinic's shareholders prepare to meet on Monday.

item.title: Mark Haines inquest hears differing opinions from detectives on teen's mysterious death
item.description: Thirty seven years after his death, police still cannot agree on how 17-year-old Mark Haines came to be found on train tracks near Tamworth.

item.title: Man charged with manslaughter over St James sudden death in Perth's south east
item.description: Homicide squad detectives charge a 33-year-old man with manslaughter over the sudden death of a 25-year-old man in Perth's south-east.

item.title: Release of Virginia Giuffre's memoir renews sex allegations against Prince Andrew
item.description: Extracts from Virginia Giuffre's posthumously released memoir have further intensified the recently renewed scrutiny on Prince Andrew.

item.title: Cohealth's closure of three Melbourne GP clinics to affect 12,500 patients
item.description: Inner-city Melbourne community health service cohealth will be shuttering its GP services at the end of the year, citing escalating costs and aging infrastructure.

item.title: National Gallery will host APY artwork exhibition after paintings cleared of improper interference
item.description: The National Gallery will host an exhibition of art from the Aṉangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands three years after a video appearing to show a non-Aboriginal assistant helping to paint an artwork led to it being postponed.

item.title: Tasma Walton and Robbie Arnott share $100,000 ARA Historical Novel Prize
item.description: Robbie Arnott's Dusk about twins hunting a puma in Tasmania, and Tasma Walton's I Am Nannertgarrook about an Aboriginal woman kidnapped and sold into slavery, have tied to win the ARA Historical Novel Prize.

item.title: Calls for Australia to follow England's ban on supermarket junk food specials
item.description: Research finding supermarkets continue to offer discounts and multi-buy deals on junk food more frequently than healthy food prompts calls for Australia to follow England's lead and ban "buy one, get one free" deals.

item.title: Oil leaking from WW2 shipwreck the Rio de Janeiro Maru in Chuuk
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'Dangerously low' funding to Tasmanian arts sector creating reputational damage, minister warned
item.description: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

item.title: Drunken motorcyclist crashes with daughter riding as passenger
item.description: A Mildura father-of-six avoids jail after drunkenly crashing his motorbike while carrying his young daughter as a passenger.

item.title: New research shows impact of lead poisoning on ancient humans
item.description: A new study claims lead might be the reason why Homo sapiens came to dominate the world.

item.title: Shocking CCTV footage shows moment bus driver assaulted while driving down Darwin highway
item.description: Shocking video footage capturing the moment a bus driver was assaulted, and passengers were thrown through the air, has been played in the NT Supreme Court after the attacker pleaded guilty.

item.title: How a 15yo autistic boy tinkering in his bedroom triggered WA's biggest ever data breach
item.description: Joshua's "passion project" with a radio scanner led to one of WA's most significant public health data breaches. His story highlights the challenges confronting autistic people caught up in the legal system.

item.title: Stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD more evidence Victoria is nation's crime capital, opposition says
item.description: CCTV footage has emerged showing a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month. The Victorian opposition says its more evidence of Victoria's standing as the country's 'crime capital.'

item.title: Woman stabbed in Melbourne's CBD in broad daylight
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74
item.description: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

item.title: SA Education Department fined after teen fell from school playground swing
item.description: South Australia's Education Department has been fined $225,000 after a student at a special school fell from a swing which had not had a comprehensive safety inspection for eight years.

item.title: Virtual emergency department a lifeline for patients in regional areas
item.description: A virtual emergency room app created during the pandemic could help bridge healthcare gaps in regional Victoria. But more patients need to dial-in and use the resource.

item.title: King Charles commemorates 40th anniversary of Uluru-Kata Tjuta handover
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Police renew appeal for information as 'inconsistencies' identified in 2022 death of toddler in Burpengary
item.description: Detectives are renewing calls for witnesses as they investigate the suspicious death of a 16-month-old boy in Burpengary in 2022.

item.title: Pacific Championships set to start without Australia as strong Samoa and Tonga teams take on New Zealand
item.description: Emerging superpowers Samoa and Tonga will field formidable teams loaded with NRL talent in the third edition of the Pacific Championships.

item.title: Broken Hill man wins appeal of sentence for animal cruelty offences
item.description: Jet Jai Johnson is released from prison two-and-a-half months into his 14-month sentence after telling a court spending his 21st birthday behind bars was a wake-up call.

item.title: Cameron Green ruled out of Australia vs India ODI series, Marnus Labuschagne called into squad
item.description: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

item.title: Family of murdered Darwin man Tony Rowe describe 'massive hole' of father's absence
item.description: Family members of Tony Rowe — who was murdered on the outskirts of Darwin in 2022 — have read emotional victim impact statements to the court ahead of killer Timothy Hunt's sentencing.

item.title: David Pye on bail after being refused anxiety drugs in custody, Nick Martin trial hears
item.description: An accused murderer and bikie gang member on trial in WA's Supreme Court amid heightened security is granted bail because he is unable to get access to anti-anxiety medication behind bars, it is revealed.

item.title: Accused killer Jason Thomas King takes stand in Molendinar landlord Susan Walker's murder trial
item.description: Jason Thomas King has pleaded not guilty to the murder of his landlord Susan Walker on the Gold Coast in 2022.

item.title: Jury finds Za'id Abdus Samad guilty of stabbing murder of uncle outside Brisbane home
item.description: A jury deliberated for one day before finding Za'id Abdus Samad guilty of the stabbing murder of his uncle in a "planned, vicious ambush" in 2017.

item.title: NT DPP confirms it will not appeal sentence for Alice Springs baby assault
item.description: The NT Director of Public Prosecutions has confirmed it will not appeal the non-custodial sentence handed to a young man who fractured the skull of a nine-week-old baby in Alice Springs.

item.title: Wittenoom asbestos contamination prompts legal threat from Banjima traditional owners
item.description: After decades of disconnection, the traditional owners of Wittenoom say they are prepared to take legal action to ensure the area is properly remediated so they can return to country.

item.title: Grimmer family sets parliamentary privilege deadline for cold case identity
item.description: A brother of three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, who vanished in 1970, has given the man who confessed to her killing a deadline to come forward or be named.

item.title: Scott Boland bowls Victoria to Sheffield Shield victory over NSW, ahead of Ashes against England
item.description: Scott Boland has produced a man-of-the-match performance, bowling Victoria to a 38-run win over New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Creating deepfakes has never been easier, so what should parents do?
item.description: Some parents may feel distressed and ill-equipped to tackle the issue of image-based abuse and deepfakes. This is what to watch out for.

item.title: Education department admits not enough done to stop Dubbo College Delroy aide harming children
item.description: The NSW government says it should have taken allegations of wrongdoing by a male school staff member more seriously. That failure left those who reported it so isolated their mental health spiralled and never fully recovered.

item.title: Young people with chronic pain feel 'unheard', misunderstood
item.description: Chronic pain affects one in five Australian children. Two young people who experience it want more people to understand their conditions and better support for all children in pain.

item.title: A few simple questions reveal the games adults aren't brave enough to play
item.description: This game revealed how rarely we are vulnerable in front of our children, and in front of each other.

item.title: James Duckworth returns to ATP Tour semifinal four years after his last
item.description: Four years since he last reached an ATP tournament semifinal in Kazakhstan, Australian James Duckworth is back in the last four at the Almaty Open

item.title: Locals swarm when air freight carrying fresh food arrives on the island
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hospital in the Home program helping young man with agoraphobia who 'cut himself off from the world'
item.description: Tom French's agoraphobia meant he couldn't leave the house to access the mental health care he needed, but a Hospital in the Home program means the care is coming to him.

item.title: Tool's Maynard James Keenan on touring Australia, making wine and martial arts
item.description: The alt-metal band's frontman is a world-class multi-tasker. He tells us how he balances it all.

item.title: Greek-inspired lamb kebabs with olive potatoes baked in the oven - ABC News
item.description: The lamb is fuss-free and full of flavour. No barbecue needed — the oven takes care of everything.

item.title: From a Springsteen biopic to a doggy horror: here are the movies out in October
item.description: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

item.title: Phoebe Litchfield learning from opening partner Alyssa Healy at Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: Alyssa Healy has joined an elite band of women batters with 7,000 international runs, and Australia's captain is giving her brilliant young opening partner something to aim for.

item.title: Melbourne CBD stabbing victim faces long emotional recovery after daylight attack
item.description: A woman stabbed in Melbourne's CBD is making a physical recovery from the incident, but is still struggling with the emotional aftermath, her family says.

item.title: Anti-bullying report outlines national strategy to crack down on behaviour
item.description: Australian schools will need to initiate action against a bullying complaint within two days of a reported incident as part of a new national plan to tackle bullying.

item.title: Zelenskyy says he trusts Trump wants to finish Ukraine war
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump tells Putin and Zelenskyy to ‘stop right now at the battle line’
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: CCTV footage from PlayShack in Palmerston shows the moment the small business was broken into.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NT chief minister claims tough-on-crime approach has led to 'significant' crime drop
item.description: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says the Country Liberal Party's tough-on-crime approach "is working". But after two teens broke into a play centre and left a trail of destruction, operator Steve Mason is not convinced.

item.title: Death doulas, family-led funerals and the deathcare movement hope to change the way we die
item.description: For many, voluntary assisted dying has come to symbolise control over how life ends. Yet dying well isn't just about those final hours. That's where a deathwalker like Zenith can help.

item.title: The deep Indigenous history of Australia deserves to be up in lights
item.description: We've flipped the script to put Indigenous Australians back at the centre of telling their own stories.

item.title: Prince Andrew's decision to give up his titles may have been quietly orchestrated by members of his own family
item.description: With the swirl of news around Prince Andrew this week, something had to be done; the question was whether he would do it himself or if his brother would be forced to show him the door.

item.title: Native mussel restoration project supported by Victor Harbor community
item.description: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

item.title: The Assembly Steve Waugh video
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How Mother Teresa helped Steve Waugh channel his 'power' for children in need
item.description: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

item.title: James Duckworth falls at Almaty Open semi-final stage against Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Australian seed-slayer James Duckworth has finally met his match in Almaty, where Daniil Medvedev dug deep to beat him in three sets.

item.title: Social media promotion of raw milk 'misleading and dangerous'
item.description: A public health expert says social media content creators are undermining years of scientific research by promoting raw milk.

item.title: Dodo and iPrimus hack impacts more than 1,600 home internet, email and mobile customers
item.description: More than 1,600 Dodo and iPrimus home internet and mobile customers have been impacted by a hack of the telco's email and mobile services, the company confirms.

item.title: GPs with extra skills who want to work in Tasmania say there are no suitable jobs
item.description: Rural generalists are GPs with training in emergency care and one other advanced skill area. While Tasmania has a training program for rural generalists, doctors say their skills are not properly recognised by the Tasmanian Health Service.

item.title: US warns of 'imminent' Hamas attack on Palestinians in Gaza in potential ceasefire breach
item.description: The United States has received "credible reports" indicating an imminent violation by Hamas of the ceasefire with Israel in Gaza.

item.title: Nationals leader wants Barnaby Joyce to 'stay', amid rumour of One Nation defection
item.description: Announcing he would not re-contest his seat of New England for the Nationals, Barnaby Joyce cited an irreparable breakdown with his party leader David Littleproud. Mr Littleproud says he still wants Mr Joyce to stay.

item.title: De Havilland Vampire Mk35A jet fighter to be restored by Dareton Men's Shed
item.description: A former RAAF jet fighter will be rebuilt by an amateur team of restorers in the second such project for a south-west New South Wales men's shed.

item.title: National Disruption Group to be established to crush tobacco black market
item.description: A new "National Disruption Group" will be convened to stamp out the exploding illicit tobacco market and other "converging" threats, the home affairs minister has announced.
